official-title.#text:
To amend the Environmental Research,
		  Development, and Demonstration Authorization Act of 1978 to provide for
		  Scientific Advisory Board member qualifications, public participation, and for
		  other purposes.

text.#text:

Board members shall be

no federally registered
				lobbyist is appointed to the Board.
The Administrator shall—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: by publishing a notification in the Federal Register;

				contracts, cooperative agreements, or other financial assistance, that are

advisory activities for the three-year period prior to

				and

text.#text:
require that, upon their provisional

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
upon such

text.#text:
make such reports public, with the

text.#text:
Disclosure of relevant professional
				activities under

Except when specifically prohibited by law,
				the Agency shall make all conflict of interest waivers granted to members of
				the Board, member committees, or investigative panels publicly
				available.

Any recusal agreement made by a member of
				the Board, a member committee, or an investigative panel, or any recusal known
				to the Agency that occurs during the course of a meeting or other work of the
				Board, member committee, or investigative panel shall promptly be made public
				by the Administrator.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				be three years and shall be staggered so that the terms of no more than
				one-third of the total membership of the

shall expire within a single
				fiscal year. No member shall serve more than two terms over a ten-year
				period.

To facilitate public participation in the
				advisory activities of the Board, the

shall hold a public information-gathering session to

or requesting scientific advice
